channel.title: Posts on Dan Munro - Software Engineer
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Dan Munro - Software Engineer

item.title: December 16th
item.description: Writing is hard, like really hard. And that is why I decided I need to start practicing again. After all, some of the best skills in life are hard to improve, yet incredibly gratifying. And the only way to get better at something is to practice it, right? Of Clouds And Developers After spending about a dozen years building infrastructure and applications in AWS, I’ve had to recently take a hiatus.

****— title: “Ten Immutable Laws Of Security: Thoughts” description: “Thoughts on the ten immutable laws of security, first published seven years ago.” image: https://danmunro.com/images/cyber.png date: 2018-09-10T21:45:02-05:00 draft: true The Laws Originally posted way back in 2011 on Microsoft Technet, here they are: If a bad guy can persuade you to run his program on your computer, it’s not solely your computer anymore. If a bad guy can alter the operating system on your computer, it’s not your computer anymore.
